info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 11:18AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Moffat and northwestern Rio Blanco Counties through NOON MDT... At 1117 AM MDT, satellite and the lightning detection network was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Rangely, or 55 miles southeast of Vernal, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Satellite and lightning detection network indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Moffat and northwestern Rio Blanco Counties. This includes Colorado 64 between mile markers 22 and 25, and between mile markers 30 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
